title: OpenChat bot definition schema
description: When a bot is registered with OpenChat it must expose its definition on a special endpoint called /bot_definition. OpenChat will make a GET request to this endpoint and must receive a response which is valid against the following schema. This is so that OpenChat can determine how the user will interact with the bot i.e. which commands it supports and what their parameter are.

description.description: A brief description of what your bot does.

commands.description: This is the list of commands that your bot supports. Note that you must have between one and fifty commands.

autonomous_config.description: Configuration for the bot's autonomous behaviour

AutonomousConfig.description: Configuration for the bot's autonomous behaviour

sync_api_key.description: Controls whether the OpenChat UI will offer to send generated api keys to this bot directly

permissions.description: The permissions required to execute in this context. These are broken down into Community level, Chat level and Message level permissions.

BotCommandDefinition.description: This is the specification of each individual command.

name.description: The name that users will use to trigger this command in OpenChat.

default_role.description: The default role assigned to the command, which must be one of the specified roles.

placeholder.description: An optional placeholder message to display in OpenChat while await the initial response from the bot

description.description: A brief description of what the command does.

params.description: List of parameters accepted by the command.

permissions.description: The permissions required to execute the command. These are broken down into Community level, Chat level and Message level permissions.

direct_messages.description: Indicates whether the command can be executed via the message entry input in direct chat mode. Only one command can support direct messages and that command must contain a single, mandatory string parameter. A good example would be a /prompt command to talk to an AI agent.

CommandParam.description: The definition for each parameter that a command can accept.

description.description: A description of what the parameter represents.

placeholder.description: A placeholder text shown when the parameter is being input.

required.description: Indicates whether this parameter is required or optional.

param_type.description: The type of parameter (e.g., string, number, boolean, or user).

anyOf.description: A parameter representing an OpenChat user.
A parameter representing a datetime as a timestamp in milliseconds

min_length.description: Minimum allowed length for the string parameter.

max_length.description: Maximum allowed length for the string parameter.

choices.description: List of predefined choices for the string parameter.

multi_line.description: Indicates that a multi-line string parameter should be expected.

min_length.description: Minimum allowed value for the integer parameter.

max_length.description: Maximum allowed value for the integer parameter.

choices.description: List of predefined choices for the integer parameter.

min_length.description: Minimum allowed value for the decimal parameter.

max_length.description: Maximum allowed value for the decimal parameter.

choices.description: List of predefined choices for the decimal parameter.

future_only.description: Indicates that only dates in the future are allowed, including now.

CommandOptionChoiceString.description: A choice for a string parameter.

CommandOptionChoiceI128.description: A choice for an integer parameter.

CommandOptionChoiceF64.description: A choice for a decimal parameter.

BotPermissions.description: Permissions required for commands to execute.

community.description: Bit mask of the required community level permissions

chat.description: Bit mask of the required chat level permissions

message.description: Bit mask of the required message level permissions
